meteorshowers = | bordering = Horologium Dorado Hydrus | latmax = 23
| latmin = 90 | month = January | notes=}} 'Reticulum' is a small, faint
constellation in the southern sky. Its name is Latin for a small net, or
reticle—a net of crosshairs at the focus of a telescope eyepiece that is
used to measure star positions. {{cite book
 | first=Ian | last=Ridpath | year=1989 | pages=10â11 title=Star Tales |
 | publisher=James Clarke & Co isbn=0-7188-2695-7 }} The constellation is
 | best viewed between October and December, but cannot be seen from middle to
 | northern latitudes. {{cite book first=Jeff A. | last=Farinacci |
 | year=2008 title=Guide to Observing Deep Sky Objects pages=150â151 |
 | publisher=Springer isbn=1-387-72850-4 }}
